page.title: 12Leytonfields Club and W.I.
page.content: This club is mainly for the over 60's or anyone who is lonely. It was formed in 1964 and there was a competition to choose the name. Members come from Woolley{Ley} Stretton{ton} and Brackenfield{field.}Now there are members from Wessington as well. There are 70 members and they meet in St.Mark's Church Rooms on the 4th Tuesday in each month at 7 p.m. There is a bus to collect members.They play cards and dominoes, have a drink of tea and a chat. At the end they play bingo. This year they have visited Bridlington and Elvaston Castle. The{Women's Institute}also meets in the Church Rooms. It was formed in 1917 and meets once a month. At the beginning of the evening there is a newsletter and then there is a speaker. They have been knitting for the Ethiopian famine appeal this year.
